name: Park Plaza Sherlock Holmes London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night whilst down for the Thames festival. First time we had stayed in this part of London and it won't be the last, loads of lovely cafes, restaraunts, bars and shops within a few minutes walk. The hotel itself was great, we got a £99 Travelzoo special which made it great value for money. The room was large with a very comfy bed and nice views of the BT tower. Breakfast was excellent , help yourself to as much as you like and all top quality ingredients. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Can't really fault anything just wish we could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Superb value in a great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel the night before our stay when we were let down at the last minute by another hotel. We were pleased with the room and the friendly service. Breakfast on the Sunday morning was good, with a wide choice at the buffet and lots of coffee refills. We will certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Late booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights here & had a very pleasant experience. Nice bar, room & very friendly staff. Plenty to do around the area & some excellent restaurants near by. We also had a very good lunch in the hotel & spent a relaxing time in the bar. Location is good & not too pricey. Would go back.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was very good, from the check in, the nice quiet room on the mezzanine level, lovely breakfasts and very friendly and courteous staff. There's even an umbrella in the wardrobe for those downpour moments! Well located being just a short trip on Bus 30 from Kings Cross. Very convenient for bus travel as the stop is outside the front of the hote.l It is also near to Marylebone with its interesting shops and eateries which I had explored on a business trip in July. Try Le Fromagerie for tasting platters of cheeses and bread as well as great cakes. Regents Park is nearby too for a restful walk in lovely grounds. We booked the hotel on a Travelzoo deal so watch out for those.
reviews.title: Chaz: Convenient base for a 3 night break

reviews.text: Having stayed at Park Plaza Westminster last year I had looked again to stay with my husband but unfortunately felt it was just a bit too pricey for what we wanted this visit, but we found the Sherlock Holmes in the same group perfect for us this visit. Excellent for the underground and when we arrive we were given an automatic upgrade. The room was well presented and very clean, comfortable bed and minibar and free snacks and water.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tried out this establishment and though it represented great value for a short visit to London. Staff were good with service being competent and friendly. Would pay another visit. The bar area is well placed with an ample overflow area to the rear. 24 hr fitness room also useful for those who wish to keep a few extra pounds at bay!
reviews.title: Good establishment in a good position

reviews.text: Great stay and highly recommended. Staff fantastic, comfy bed big room, top amenities and perfect location. I will definitely be back next time I am in London. Great location with plenty of restaurants on the doorstep, cinema and shops. Keep up the great work.
reviews.title: Top staff and great hotel, I will be back. Thank you

reviews.text: Bang in the heart of London on Baker street, this place is great as a base if your sole intention is to explore all of central London attractions.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms, excellent location

reviews.text: Otherwise the rooms are quite small and the property is old.
reviews.title: Sauna

reviews.text: I was there as a sole business traveller and so the room size did not matter to me but would definitely give this place a miss if I come back with family.
reviews.title: Good location and value for Central London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost walked past the entrance it's so hidden in Baker St. appearing as a better bar from the street, the narrow frontage cloaks the expanse deeper back and expanding wider on higher floors.
reviews.title: Quietly surprised!

reviews.text: Our room on corridor 't' junction and over looking Baker Street it's self -- this where we received our biggest surprise -- it was soooo quiet, from foot fall or the busy road. Though neigbouring rooms could be heard using the clunky furniture. Very quiet nights.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Ideally sittuated for mainline station of Marlebone and under ground Baker Street, perfect for travel to all sites of the city, if you like shopping Oxford street a stroll away.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at a fair price, very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With food available all day it was perfect for us in preparing form theatre night, and to settle with night cap on return from theatre land bars 'n' bussle.
reviews.title: Staff make this place

reviews.text: We had to check out early but needed to leave luggage until London departure late PM, no problem in leaving luggage - being so close to stations perfect for this late collection.
reviews.title: Good location, clean room and kind staff

reviews.text: Ideal location from euston train station , passing madam tussards on the way, were also you can get the bus tour from.hotel is half way down baker steet ,close by are all you need cafes, tescos,macs etc would definatley return
reviews.title: Charming hotel in an ideal location with very friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: Stayed here with some friends on August bank hold wknd. Paid £160 per room and it was just about worth it. Room was quite small and facilities in the room were limited. Nice location too really close to Baker Street
reviews.title: Nice hotel but just about a 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel by way of a TravelZoo offer and to be honest I have passed the hotel many times before but never thought of staying there. The frontage of the Hotel is fairly small and it is not apparant that the hotel is much larger than its first appearance however small enough to be very personable. The location was excellent and we were able to walk easily to the West End had an easy walk to both Baker Street Tube and Euston Mainline station. What was most impressive though was the lovely and helpful welcome (and we were able to check in early), and the friendly and professional service in the bar and restaurant which is unusual for a reasonably priced London Hotel these days. The room was very pleasant with very comfortable beds, excellent white cotton sheets, spare pillows and an iron and ironing board provided. The only minor issue being the lack of bedside lights but certainly it did not detract from our stay.
reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: The Breakfast was excellent with good quality food and good service. Drinks prices were also reasonable and I had the best Campari and Orange I have had served for a long time - great tasting Orange Juice and beautifully presented - All in all very well done - We would recommend and we will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Theatre and shopping break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night here for a theatre night and shopping on the Saturday. The hotel is in a great location for walking to the shops or public transport. The hotel is lovely and staff and service fantastic. Breakfast was absolutely delightful with a plentiful selection. Our room was lovely and spacious together with a great bathroom. Would definitely return again for another getaway weekend.
reviews.title: Average but reasonable value for money

aka: Park Plaza Sherlock Holmes London Hotel
description: Traditional Regency-style Hotel situated 200 yards from Baker Street tube station & convenient to West End.
